intro: Pterocephalus brachiatus, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. The flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
